intro: Lathyrus nissolius, commonly known as the purple larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Lathyrus nissolius is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
